locations.name: Statue of Liberty, New York
locations.notes: An iconic symbol of freedom and democracy. Gifted by France to the United States.

locations.name: Eiffel Tower, Paris
locations.notes: An iron tower completed in 1889 as the entrance arch for the 1889 World's Fair.

locations.name: Pyramids of Giza, Egypt
locations.notes: The last of the original Seven Wonders of the Ancient World still in existence.

locations.name: Taj Mahal, India
locations.notes: A white marble mausoleum commissioned in 1632 by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

locations.name: Christ the Redeemer, Rio de Janeiro
locations.notes: A large statue of Jesus Christ that overlooks Rio de Janeiro. Completed in 1931.

locations.name: Great Wall of China
locations.notes: A series of fortifications made of stone, brick, and other materials. Built to protect Chinese states against raids.

locations.name: Sydney Opera House, Australia
locations.notes: A multi-venue performing arts centre, one of the 20th century's most distinctive buildings.

locations.name: Machu Picchu, Peru
locations.notes: An ancient Incan city set high in the Andes Mountains. Often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas'.

locations.name: Colosseum, Rome
locations.notes: An ancient Roman amphitheater known for gladiator contests and other public spectacles.

locations.name: Petra, Jordan
locations.notes: Historical and archaeological city famous for its rock-cut architecture.

locations.name: Moai Statues, Easter Island
locations.notes: Monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people.

locations.name: Angkor Wat, Cambodia
locations.notes: The largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple for the Khmer Empire.

locations.name: Mount Everest, Nepal/Tibet
locations.notes: The highest mountain in the world, part of the Himalaya range.

locations.name: Gal√°pagos Islands, Ecuador
locations.notes: An archipelago of volcanic islands known for its unique endemic species studied by Charles Darwin.
